column4: does anyone know what could cause programs to keep spontaneously closing on me with no sort of error message or anything?
or how i would go about investigating it
maybe run them from a terminal, then at least you will be able to see the exit status, or if it returns an error to stdout
what would cause them to occur? (sorry if this is a really broad question)
i am not 100% sure they are segfaults, thats why run them from a terminal
if anything goes wrong, there will definetely be something in the terminal for you
good idea... except sometimes they don't crash for days. And it's not always one particular program, there are at least 3 that crash on me
thanks for the advice though, I'll try that
if something does happen to cause a seg fault and I get some sort of an error in the terminal, how will I be able to debug that?
i don't think you can just FIX segfaults, they are usually problems in the programs design
but then there is always the option of trying other versions, if the segfault was on an unstable
a segfault is when your program tries to access memory outside its allocated space
well the programs that are crashing regularly are kicker, mozilla-firefox and opera (to name a few) so i don't see how they could be poorly coded
could it be a hardware issue?
then maybe its not a segfault. wait for another crash
watch out you'll start a major flame war =/
